jobTitle: Corporate Accounting Manager/Assistant Controller – LA Office, Hybrid
description:
Job Title: Corporate Accounting Manager/Assistant Controller


Grade: Experienced Professional


Location: Los Angeles, California, United States


Type: Hybrid – 3 days onsite per week.


Salary Range: $100,000 – $150,000 + bonus


Benefits: 401k, medical, vision, dental and disability insurance.


Job Summary


Reporting directly to the CFO, this dynamic position will be key in shaping the company’s financial strategy, ensuring accurate financial reporting, and managing both tactical and strategic financial operations. The Corporate Accounting Manager/Assistant Controller will work hand in hand with the CFO to build the future of Marshall & Stevens’ finance team. This role will lead the accounting team, integrating several acquisitions and systems, and implementing scalable processes to drive efficiency and growth.


Accountability And Scope


This role is responsible for managing Marshall and Stevens’ Corporate General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, and Treasury, including current and future acquisitions. Additionally, this role will be pivotal in building and synergizing accounting functions across multiple acquisitions and creating dashboards and reporting templates. The Corporate Accounting Manager is accountable for the accuracy and integrity of the information provided to the business and plays a key role in developing and maintaining effective relationships across all levels of the organization to fully understand business needs and how Accounting can positively impact operations.


Essential Job Duties And Responsibilities

  • Manage the day-to-day operations of the accounting department, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, and general ledger activities.
  • Oversee the month-end and year-end close processes, ensuring accuracy and timeliness of financial reporting.
  • Supervise time-keeping and employee expense reimbursement processes.
  • Prepare and review financial statements.
  • Assist with budgeting and forecasting as needed.
  • Develop and implement internal controls to safeguard company assets and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
  • Coordinate with external auditors and tax consultants during audits and tax filings.
  • Analyze financial data and provide insights to senior management for strategic decision-making.
  • Stay abreast of changes in accounting standards and regulations, ensuring compliance and recommending process improvements as necessary.
  • Lead the integration and synergy of financial operations for acquired companies.
  • Help automate accounting processes and procedures to ensure scalability and efficiency.
  • Program and plan the implementation of Acumatica, ensuring it meets the needs of the growing business.
  • Manage Marshall and Stevens’ Corporate General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, and Treasury, including current and future acquisitions.


Qualifications And Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance; CPA preferred.
  • 5 to 10 years of accounting experience.
  • Management experience is preferred.
  • Proven ability in the areas of Financial Analysis, Auditing, Sarbanes-Oxley, and Financial Reporting.
  • Experience in a Private Equity environment is preferred.
  • Must be a US Citizen or a US Permanent Resident per ITAR.
  • Ability to consolidate financial reporting and analysis across multiple entities.
  • Demonstrated ability to develop models and other tools of analysis for financial management reporting.
  • Competency with large integrated accounting systems and Microsoft Suite software, including Excel and Access.
  • Familiarity with Acumatica, Netsuite or similar ERP systems.
  • Ability to be onsite 3 days a week.
